message_1: What is the smallest prime number p for which (p-1)! + 1 is not divisible by p?
message_2: According to Wilson's theorem, for a prime number p, (p-1)! + 1 is divisible by p. Therefore, there is no smallest prime number p for which (p-1)! + 1 is not divisible by p, as this property holds true for all prime numbers.
